    The #GreatSaltLake (#gsl) 'in October fell to the lowest levels on record.' "Scientists want to understand how much risk the dust’s toxic metals pose to humans, what level of exposure is unsafe and what the implications for Utahans could be over time. No matter what they find, it’s a threat that will only continue to grow as lake levels drop." "“We have 2.5 million residents along the edges of the lake,” said Kevin Perry, a University of Utah atmospheric scientist researching the Great Salt Lake dust. “These dust plumes come off and make the air unhealthy regardless of what’s in it.”" 
Worth the read! #arsenic #pollution #wastewater #water #human #toxicdust #soil #exposure #uofu #universityofutah #utah 
https://lnkd.in/gxWSvGJe

  



        

      
            
      
      
    
    

    
      
        
      

      
        
            
              The Great Salt Lake is drying up and turning into toxic dust
            

            
                nbcnews.com

"Scientists want to understand how much risk the dust’s toxic metals pose to humans, what level of exposure is unsafe and what the implications for Utahans could be over time. No matter what they find, it’s a threat that will only continue to grow as lake levels drop." "“We have 2.5 million residents along the edges of the lake,” said Kevin Perry, a University of Utah atmospheric scientist researching the Great Salt Lake dust. “These dust plumes come off and make the air unhealthy regardless of what’s in it.”" Worth the read! #arsenic #pollution #wastewater #water #human #toxicdust #soil #exposure #uofu #universityofutah #utah https://lnkd.in/gxWSvGJe
